title: European shares dip on heavy earnings day as euro rebounds
text:
May 3, 2018 / 7:42 AM / Updated 16 minutes ago European shares dip on heavy earnings day as euro rebounds Reuters Staff 2 Min Read
MILAN (Reuters) - European shares fell in morning trading on Thursday, weighed down by a rebound in the euro from four-month lows against the dollar in a day dominated by earnings updates. 20 Euro banknotes are displayed is this picture illustration taken November 14, 2017. REUTERS/Benoit Tessier/Illustration
By 0719 GMT, the pan-European STOXX 600 index fell 0.2 percent, retracing from three-month highs, while Germany’s DAX and Britain’s FTSE also fell slightly.
Among big companies that reported results, adidas ( ADSGn.DE ) fell 2.6 percent after the German sportswear firm posted sales growth slightly shy of analyst expectations, although net profit rose more than expected.
Smith & Nephew ( SN.L ) slumped 6.5 percent after Europe’s biggest artificial hip and knee maker cut its forecast for full-year underlying revenue growth after some markets softened and it saw a slowdown in its bioactives business. Bpost ( BPOST.BR ) fell 12 percent as results lagged expectations.
Elsewhere, however, some well-received company updates provided support. Logitech ( LOGN.S ) rose 8.4 percent following a better than expected quarterly results.
French utility Veolia ( VIE.PA ) rose 3 percent after quarterly revenues rose, as its French water business returned to growth and international activities also showed double-digit growth. Reporting by Danilo Masoni, Editing by Helen Reid
